intro: Onosma waddellii f. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf onosma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue to purple flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are broader than the typical species, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical structure includes a fibrous root system and stems that are often covered in a powdery coating.
